snippet: As a proportion of the overall economy, corporate profits were at their highest since 1929, while wages and benefits were at their lowest for any year ever measured.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column; corporate profits, as proportion of overall economy, are at their highest since 1929, while wages and benefits are at their lowest for any year ever measured; Commerce Department estimates that corporations earned $2.1 trillion during 2013, paying $419 billion in taxes, with after-tax profit of $1.7 trillion, or 10 percent of gross domestic product during year.
lead_paragraph: As a proportion of the overall economy, corporate profits were at their highest since 1929, while wages and benefits were at their lowest for any year ever measured.

headline.print_headline: Corporate Profits Grow and Wages Slide
headline.main: Corporate Profits Grow and Wages Slide
